newsitem.title: USA: SEC prepares action on soft dollar abuses - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: SEC prepares action on soft dollar abuses - WSJ.

text.p: The Securities and Exchange Commission is preparing enforcement action against "soft dollar" abuses in the financial industry, The Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday.
The story cites Commission officials saying they are probing brokerage firms, mutual funds and investment advisors.
Soft dollars are arrangements between brokerage firms and money managers in which the funds' commissions are used to pay for services, the story said.
The SEC is probing possible instances where the agreements appear to be a misuse of fund-investors' money, the story said.
